definitions: If you get a glimpse of someone or something, you see them very briefly and not very well.
If you glimpse someone or something, you see them very briefly and not very well.
A glimpse of something is a brief experience of it or an idea about it that helps you understand or appreciate it better.
to catch sight of briefly or momentarily
to look (at) briefly or cursorily; glance (at)
to catch a brief, quick view of, as in passing; perceive momentarily and incompletely
a faint, fleeting appearance; slight trace
a very brief, passing look, sight, or view
to catch or take a glimpse of
to come into view; appear faintly
